noun.description: A small ornamental mat made of lace or paper with a lace pattern, typically placed on a plate under a cake or other sweet foods.

origin: Late 17th century: from Doiley or Doyley, the name of a 17th-century London draper. The word originally denoted a woolen material used for summer wear, said to have been introduced by this draper. The current sense (originally doily napkin) dates from the early 18th century.
